data.title: Build API with Light Framework

data.summary: In this article, I will walk you through the Light Framework step by step on Linux environment in development mode.
data.title: Start Light Framework with two demo sites in development mode
data.content:
### Create a project folder

I am assuming you are using Linux desktop like Ubuntu but the instruction will work on Mac and Windows with some modifications. First you need to create a project folder in your home directory.

For example, my user directory is /home/steve and I will create a new folder named project and clone the light framework from github.

```
mkdir project
cd project
git clone https://github.com/networknt/light.git
```

### Build Light Framework from command line
In order to build the framework you need to install the following software packages. 
1. Oracle JDK 1.8
2. Apache Maven 3.3.x
3. Node
4. Npm

Now, let's build the server and start it
```
cd light
mvn clean install
cd server/target
setsid java -jar light-server.jar < /dev/zero & > /dev/null &
```

Now the Light server is up and a database named lightdb will be created under your home directory by replay the events.

### Start and debug server from IDE
 If you want to start server from your IDE or debug into it, open your IDE (Eclipse or Idea) and open the project from folder light. Both Eclipse and Idea will import the parent pom.xml. To server the server, navigate to server/src/main/java/com/networknt/light/server and run LightServer class. If the database doesn't exist, it will create a new one under your home directory by replaying events.

Once the server is ready, you should see the following messages on the console.

```
2016-03-09 20:23:31,396 [XNIO-1 I/O-1] DEBUG org.xnio.niorun(431) - Started channel thread 'XNIO-1 I/O-1', selector sun.nio.ch.EPollSelectorImpl@2790e59d
2016-03-09 20:23:31,396 [XNIO-1 I/O-2] DEBUG org.xnio.niorun(431) - Started channel thread 'XNIO-1 I/O-2', selector sun.nio.ch.EPollSelectorImpl@6471ccf5

```

### Start www.networknt.com with react hot loader

www.networknt.com is a live site to promote the framework and hosting sites built on the framework. In order to run the site locally, you need to update your /etc/hosts to point 127.0.0.1 to it.

```
sudo gedit /etc/hosts
```

Add the following line right after 127.0.0.1
```
127.0.0.1       www.edibleforestgarden.ca www.networknt.com
```

To start the server in hot loader mode.

```
cd ~
cd project/light/networknt
npm installl
npm start
```

### Test and update the www.networknt.com
Now open your browser (Chrome or Firefox) and the address is www.networknt.com:3000

The site will be loaded and you can login with test/123456 for normal user or you can login with stevehu/123456 as owner

### Start www.edibleforestgarden.ca with react hot loader
You have to stop www.networknt.com before starting www.edibleforestgarden.ca as they are listening to the same port.

To start the server in hot loader mode
```
cd ~
cd project/light/edibleforestgarden
npm install
npm start
```
The address for the site is www.edibleforestgarden.ca:3000

You can try to update the site with your IDE and the browser will be updated automatically with react-hot-loader.
